metadata.title: CVE-2017-5203 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The BOOTP parser in tcpdump before 4.9.0 has a buffer overflow inprint-bootp.c:bootp_print().

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5203` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

tcpdump - 4.9.0-1ubuntu1~ubuntu14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tcpdump package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.9.0-1ubuntu1~ubuntu14.04.1').
